subject: WIP Do not operate on the live CIB with pcs commands
commit_message:
WIP Do not operate on the live CIB with pcs commands

When doing composable HA we typically create different pacemaker
resources on the nodes that require it (i.e. not from a single node).
This is problematic due to https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1404233
The problem is that when node A creates resource foo and at the same
time node B creates resource bar, there is an inherent race condition
because if both node A and B get a copy of the CIB at the same time,
the latter one to push the cib back (via pcs) will win and overwrite
the changes of the former one.

The most solid approach we discussed here is to use pacemaker's diff
feature so that only a specific diff is sent on the wire and not the
whole CIB. This will make sure we avoid this race because we never
create overlapping resources from the same nodes. This differential
change requires that we do the following:
- Snapshot the CIB via "pcs cluster cib snapshot.xml"
- Make a copy of the CIB "cp snapshot.xml snapshot.xml.org"
- Make all changes via pcs -f snapshot.xml ....
- Push back the changes via an upcoming pcs command:
  pcs cluster cib-push snapshot.xml --diff=snapshot.xml.orig

WIP is for three reasons:
1) Still need to do proper testing
2) Still waiting on an upcoming pcs change (actually this is not
   strictly true for a number of reasons)

subject: Enable oslo_middleware proxy header parsing
commit_message:
Enable oslo_middleware proxy header parsing

Heat has moved to using oslo_middleware for the http proxy header
parsing, however the default is to not parse the headers.  When
the external protocol differs from the internal protocol this
parsing is required in order for heat to work properly since it
will return 302 redirects to the client during some operations
(such as delete stack).

An example of this is when using haproxy with https configured
for the external protocol and http for the internal protocol.
If the oslo_middleware does not parse the headers, then any
302 redirects would specify a url with http rather than
correctly specifying https and the heat client would fail to
connect on the redirect url.

Enable oslo_middleware proxy header parsing

Heat has moved to using oslo_middleware for the http proxy header
parsing, however the default is to not parse the headers.  When
the external protocol differs from the internal protocol this
parsing is required in order for heat to work properly since it
will return 302 redirects to the client during some operations
(such as delete stack).

An example of this is when using haproxy with https configured
for the external protocol and http for the internal protocol.
If the oslo_middleware does not parse the headers, then any
302 redirects would specify a url with http rather than
correctly specifying https and the heat client would fail to
connect on the redirect url.

subject: Default performance schema to off
commit_message:
Default performance schema to off

The 5.6 version of mysql defauls to performance_schema=on at server
startup. This allocates all the memory that would be required to
handle max-connections plus several other memory settings.

We occasionally saw connection exhaustion in HA clouds with
max-connections near 2000. The common practice became to set
max-connections unrealistically high near 10k or 20k. In the move to
5.6 on Xenial this became a problem as the memory requirements for
values that high are unrealistic.

This change adds performance schema as a configuration option and
defaults to off giving 5.5 like behavior. It also considerably
updates documentation and highlights the need to carefully consider
memory related configuration settings for production environments.

subject: Combine bridge networks
commit_message:
Combine bridge networks

1. What is the problem?
The current implementation of bridge networks has some problems
when supporting DVR and shared VxLAN network. One blueprint has
been registered[1] and the specification document has also been
submitted[2].

2. What is the solution to the problem?
The logic of bridge network operations will be changed, here lists
some major changes:
(1) Only one bridge network will be created for one project
(2) Bridge network is attached to local router as external network
(3) One local router dedicated for north-south networking will be
    created in the pod hosting real external network. Bridge network
    is attached to this special router as internal network
(4) If the instance port is not located in the pod hosting real
    external network, after floating ip association, one "copy" port
    will be created in the pod hosting real external network. Without
    this port, local Neutron server will complain that it cannot find
    the internal port going to be associated.

3.What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
  to realize the solution?
Bring part of the DVR support to cross-pod layer-3 networking

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tricircle/+spec/combine-bridge-net
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/396564/

subject: Fix the check of docker installation
commit_message:
Fix the check of docker installation

In before, we checked docker installation by:

  $ rpm -q docker-engine

However, this doesn't work for all cases in fedora 24.
* If docker was installed by "sudo dnf install docker-engine", the
  package will be named as "docker". Therefore, it should be checked
  by "rpm -q docker".
* If docker was installed by devstack (by using
  https://get.docker.com/), the package will be named as
  "docker-engine". Therefore, it should be checked by
  "rpm -q docker-engine".

This commit added check for "docker" as well.
